a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Income shares by quintile, United States, 1974 to 2019
The income share is the percentage of the national income received by a segment of the population â€“ in this case in
subgroups of 20% ordered from lowest to highest income.
Data source: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform
Note: Depending on the country and year, the data relates to either disposable income or consumption per capita.
